div.head: [Wren Diary]
div.p:
Friday & Saturday, I being sick failed to write and now I will relate the circumstances. Yesterday I went to preaching and heard another eccentric sermansermon from Mr.Yarbrough. To-day there was a circumstance that took place that I have never known here before, Giggerone of our fellow students drowned. I have finished reading Stuart,Mary Queen of Scots Mearry Queen of Scots and her son that she bore became KeingKing Sixth of Scotland
and First of England. Stuart,Henry Lord DarnleyDarnley Stuart,Mary Queen of Scots Mary's second husband treated her very bad hes finally killed by Hepburn, James 4th Earl of BothwellBothwell who afterwards married her, and she was thought to have had some hand in putting him to death but not known. The people were all so much incensed at her that they finally waged war against them and took her a way from him and had her confined for some time and sent for the EearlEarl of MurryMoray to act as regent forHepburn,James 4th Earl of BothwellJamesand made her sign papers cirtifyingcertifyingthat she had given up the right to him. She finally by the help of her friends was released from captivity and many of them joined her and the waged war against MurryMoray her brother and was defeated and she then fled to Englandfor help from the Queen but She there fell into the hands of one that was her enemy. Stuart,Mary Queen of Scots Mary was kept in captivity for many years until her son obtained the crown in Scotland and She was finally caught trying to work some plans to be freed from her captivity and it was said She and her friends were working some plan to put Tudor,ElizabethElizabethto death, she was finally tryedtried and condemed to die but the warentwarrant had to be signed by the Queen and the first sums as if she didn't want to do it but she did it and Stuart,Mary Queen of Scots Mary was beheded, and when she was on the eve of death we can but notice her composure and the manner in which She took her death and even swore with her hand on the bible that she never had done any thing to injure Tudor,ElizabethElizabethand her last prayer was in fact offered up for Tudor,ElizabethElizabethand her son and others that treated her very bad.

There being no recitations to day I have been reading something of the traitor Arnold, Benedict Benedic Arnold. And I have not read enough to find out much that will give me light concerning the question. I find Arnold was a real traitor and among his worst deeds was that of sending MeajorMajor Andre through the American lines and thus caused him to be killed and in all his meaning was not finished but finally died a natural death.

To-day I have attended recitations regularly but have not been called upon. I have read the life or author a sketch of the life of Hamilton, AlexanderHamilton and the circumstances of his being killed by Burr, Aaron Burr . Burr, Aaron Burr has been greatly blamed and no doubt he deverves all the blame but it seems strange that Hamilton,AlexanderHamilton should meet a man to fight a duel and not intend to try to kill him as it is said by Hamilton, AlexanderHamilton, I dont think he ought to have meetmet him if he didnt intend to shoot at him so it seems rather obscure to me.

I have been to recitations to day and called upon once as we only had one and had experiments the other hour but had very little of importance shown. This evening we had no recitations but I read some of the Pilgrim Progress. I recieved a letter from Lewis,BillBill Lewis this evening which I read with much pleasure and wrote one to Mr Quasles Adrin
